dcterms:description: Quantum expander codes are used for efficient quantum error correction and are designed to optimize the performance of quantum encoders and decoders.
dcterms:title: Quantum expander codes

dcterms:creator: R. Laflamme
C. Miquel
J. P. Paz
W. H. Zurek
dcterms:description: The five qubit code is the shortest quantum error correcting code that can protect against depolarizing one-qubit errors.
dcterms:title: Five qubit code

dcterms:creator: A. R. Calderbank
E. M. Rains
P. W. Shor
N. J. Sloane
dcterms:description: The classical [7, 4] Hamming code is used as a basis for generating quantum error correcting codes, specifically in the context of quantum error correction via codes over GF(4).
dcterms:title: Classical [7, 4] Hamming code
